abstract: Calculating the wages of workers in China’s large technology manufacturers is complicated.
snippet: Calculating the wages of workers in China’s large technology manufacturers is complicated.
lead_paragraph: Foxconn Technology, one of the world’s largest electronics manufacturers, and a major supplier for Apple, has announced that it will raise salaries and decrease overtime at its factories in China. The Times’s David Barboza wrote, “Foxconn said that salaries for many workers would immediately jump by 16 to 25 percent, to about $400 a month, before overtime.”

headline.main: The iEconomy: How Much Do Foxconn Workers Make?
